name: Zachary J. Millimet
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2014
review_body: I did a painstaking amount of research prior to purchasing this lens back in December 2013.  IAt the time, I was looking to upgrade from the mediocre kit lens that came with my Canon T3i and I went back and forth between this lens, a litany of Canon L lenses, as well as considering just buying 2 separate prime lenses.  At the end of the day, I don't think I could have gone wrong with any of my choices.  It's hard to go wrong with high end Primes and Canon's L series lenses at the lower focal lengths are fantastic.  So why did I buy the Sigma.  Certainly, the reviews from professionals were all stellar.  This gave me peace of mind  Second, I spent a lot of time considering how I like to shoot.  I really dislike using flash, bur rather prefer fast lenses with low F-stops to allow me to shoot indoors and in low light situations without flash, when possible.  So the fact that this lens allows F/1.8 was a big selling feature.  The fact that it was fixed across all the focal lengths really started to sell me.  Lastly, this lens covers a small, but critical zoom range:  18-35mm.  Especially because I shoot on a cropped body camera, this is the range I mostly live in all the time when shooting.  This lens is perfect - functing like a prime, across a critical focal range.  Some people have noted that it can be a bit soft on autofocus or mis-focus when using certain camera bodies.  I choice my focal points very specifically, and this has not been an issues for me.  The bokeh is very good, some lenses are better, but still this lens produces great bokeh.  It is also a very large and heavy lens - there is a lot of glass here.  Any prospective buyer should be aware of this.  For me, I have come to appreciate this heft of the lens - it is part of what I love about this lens.

name: me
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2016
review_body: I have had this lens for 6 months now and feel I can give a useful review. The first thing is this is a large and heavy lens. I carried it on a k3ii at the state fair for a full day and was always aware that it was there. This is not a lens that I can "forget" is there. Only my 60-250 f4 is larger and heavier. One thing that helps though is that it does not extend when zoomed. Some have complained that the lens cap is difficult to put on and does not stay on well; I find it takes a little more attention when installing but is not that difficult and stays on as well as any other I have. The lens shade is a nice small diameter, unlike the monster on the 12-24 f4, which makes it nicer when in the backpack and not on the camera. Focus is a real issue with this lens and many have given up on it for that reason, though some seem to get a reasonably good one out of the box. Mine was OK at all focal lengths except 35mm which I fixed with a -5 setting at that length with the dock. Now it focuses as well as any lens I have. Sharpness is very good but at 35mm my FA 35 f2 is just as sharp except wide open. I have used this lens indoors without a flash but you must remember that at large f-stops the depth of field is VERY shallow and focus must be spot on to get sharp results. Focus is fast and quiet and it does not hunt. There is some flair under certain conditions but this must be expected with 17 lens elements and so much glass.The build quality is equal to any Pentax lens I have. With the limited zoom range and size and weight that cannot be ignored I consider this lens somewhat of a niche lens; too limited to be a do all walk around lens but uniquely useful for certain applications and I am very glad to own it.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2016
review_body: I bought this lens as the final leg of an awesome trifecta... Panny GH4, Metabones Speed Booster and yep... SIGMA 18-35 F1.8. This is an awesome combination and it's done everything I've asked of it thus far. Just for the heck of it I put the SIGMA on my T3i to see how it compared to my Canon 17-55 2.8 EFS. I didn't do the kind of testing you see some folks do on YouTube, etc. but there seemed to be considerably less chromatic aberration around edges as compared to the Canon. I primarily shoot video and if the SIGMA had OIS I probably would have given it five stars. Be warned, it IS heavy and I do miss the range compared to the Canon but the image quality is superior. Like most photo and video equipment, whether or not this lens is for you depends on how you plan on using it. I see a lot of folks complaining about focus issues but as a videographer I just about never use autofocus and because the GH4 has focus peaking I never have a problem getting the shot.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2014
review_body: I originally reviewed this lens when it first came out around 5 years ago. It's IQ and quality build is second to none. There is review after review online about how good this lens is. It's interesting that I feel limited on a cropped sensor body when I use a 35mm prime, however, when I have this 18-35 I tend to want more zoom. Canon has the 17-40 f/4 that offers 5mm greater zoom however that lens is no where near as good as this lens. I don't even consider them in the same category. There is one major drawback; not enough to reduce a star, but that is the size and weight of this lens. I took some excellent low light fish photos at the Monterey Bay Aquarium with this lens. I was there for approx 4 hours and it did not weigh too heavy on me. Anything longer than 4 hours might begin to takes it's toll if you are not used to carrying around a heavy lens. Overall I don't think there is another lens like this around. It's in a class of it's own. You can replace a few primes (24 and 35mm) for this lens. I enthusiastically recommend this lens.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2017
review_body: I've been using this lens with my Nikon D7100 for over three years and I use it 95% of the time as I shoot mostly landscapes and it works well for portraits too at 30-35mm.  This lens brings my Nikon crop sensor camera pretty close to full-frame quality.  The only problem I have with using a non-Nikon lens is there's no in-camera auto correction for lens distortion, so I would have to buy Adobe Lightroom to correct for the distortion.  I find Nikon's View NX2 software is excellent at post processing my RAW images so I really don't want to buy Lightroom just to fix the lens distortion.  And if I do buy Lightroom I'll have to redo all my old RAW files that I've already processed with View NX2.  But if you already have Lightroom then there's no reason not to get this lens as it's as good as it gets at a price that's a relative bargain.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2018
review_body: A very sharp lens, with a very fast and usable large aperture, f 1.8. It is sharp at f1.8 and just gets sharper until f8 when diffraction begins to set in. It is still very usable at f16 for greater depth of field.  It is sharp across the field of view, center to corner. It has the focal length equivalent on a full frame camera of 27mm to 52mm.  Not a huge range, but a useful one.  It is reported to be sharpest at 18mm but it is sharp at all focal lengths. It is a somewhat heavy lens, but very well built.  It does not have vibration reduction.  But it is very hand holdable in the 1/25 of a second to 1/100th of a second depending on focal length.  Higher shutter speeds are of course better. Highly recommended for Nikon and Canon crop sensor cameras.

review_body: This lens turned out to be heavier than I thought it would be, but definitely not problematic.  I like the solid feel it has on the Nikon D500, and even on an older D7100.  One of the reasons I went with all Sigma lenses was because of problems with auto-focus.  Sigma gives me the option (with the USB dock) of adjusting any back or front focusing issues.  I prefer this over trying to go through the incomplete effort of changing the focus issues in the camera.

name: DJ Savage
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_body: This lens is amazing and probably the best lens you will ever have, but it is only for cinematography.  It is a Super clear lens  Great for cinema but this is not a lens made for photography. The only thing I did not like about this lens is that it is a bit heavy but maybe that is the reason it is such a great lens, so I can live with that. You will have to add pull focus/zoom gears to this lens, not a deal breaker. If you’re serious about filming, this is your lens.

review_body: I use this on my a6500 coupled with mc-11.  sony when used with its native lenses produces a very digital-looking images. But when I put this sigma on, wow, im very surpised it produces images with full of life - similar on what i see with my 5dm4.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
review_body: Very well built! Although focus is a hit and miss at low light situations. Tack sharp when it hits the spot. Impressive performance regarding image quality in low light. A modeling light is enough to get Impressive results in a studio environment.

name: ColoCultureMedia
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2019
review_body: If you are making Youtube videos or any videos. Buy this.  There is tons of evidence that this is a great lens on Youtube.  I use this with a 70D to make YT videos and with a Lumix G85.  Yea it is heavy but no matter what you are shooting it is going to be crisp.  The only other lens I use is a 10-18 when needing a super wide angle. This is a bokeh monster.  I've even used it to vlog.  Willzworldmedia on youtube for more visuals in 4k.

name: GenVicious
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2014
review_body: I have used a wide range and variety of lenses. This is by far one of the best and more superior lenses that I have ever used. I used to be a big supporter of 50mm f/1.4 lenses, don't get me wrong I still use my sigma 50mm, but the investment on this lens is worth EVERY penny. I'm big on videography and shoot in a lot of lowlight settings. All I have to say is, if you are big on landscape or even portrait photography, this is the lens to invest on. You won't have to upgrade for a long time. This lens heavily outweighs the use of my 50mm. I've never had a problem with any sigma lenses. I was also thinking of getting the 17-50mm f/2.8, but my room mate has one and this lens I have to say still out shines it's performance. If i could give this lens a 10/5 I would, but 5/5 should do. Hope this review finds yous well.

name: Fellow Traveler
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2013
review_body: Congratulations to Sigma for bringing us this new and exciting product and, whats more, at an affordable price!

name: S. Minor
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2016
review_body: This lens is a BEAUTY. Its solid, heavy, and very premium feeling. It pairs nicely with my GH4 when using an adapter. Its VERY sharp, might as well be a prime. I essentially use it as my 24-70 on Micro 4/3. I pair it with a Rokinon 12mm so I have my wide angle covered and this baby tackles the rest. Smooth focus and aperture ring. Since I use a dummy adapter on my GH4, I haven't tested the autofocus yet. I'm very happy with the image quality and color from this lens, I haven't noticed any chromatic aberration either. It's plenty sharp for the GH4 filming in 4K. It's also very fast, which helps small sensors in dark settings. It doesn't work miracles but it holds it's own. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a great all-around lens on M43.

name: Andrew P Sorensen
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2015
review_body: First off know what you're buying...but if you do, you won't be disappointed. This is by far the sharpest lens I've shot with. I plan on shooting with this far more extensively but wanted to say I'm impressed. This is not a "macro" lens but I used it to shoot small objects and got far more detail than I had expected.

name: Murdock
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
review_body: The lens is great! Good build quality and really sharp. I’m using it with an adapter on my Sony a6500, so I’m not sure if I’m getting the full potential of the autofocus, but it’s a great lens for an amazing price.

name: Jules
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021
review_body: Great lens love it

name: Rush Fan
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2017
review_body: Couldn't be more pleased. I purchased this lens for my Canon T6S. I was a little concerned about ordering as there have been reports of focusing issues requiring the Sigma USB dock to calibrate. I decided against the dock figuring I could always add that if necessary. Well, happy to report that this lens focuses perfectly right out of the box. Both One Shot and AI Servo, no issues. Can focus within just a few inches at 35 mm (actually about 56 considering crop factor) and at f1.8, background blur is excellent and very uniform.

name: Benjamin Anderson
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2018
review_body: I never write reviews. Today I am. Received mine today and this is the only lens I will ever need again. I was hoping to get my money's worth and I did. Right out of the box, everything I'm shooting looks amazing. The bouquet is stunning. Focusing issues that I've read about? I bought the dock and haven't fine-tuned anything yet and am not sure if I'll need to - I have no complaints. I bought this lens for video after seeing some excellent cinematic-quality footage and I was able to recreate that look within hours. Unbelievable quality. Save yourself some money - this lens is at least 3 primes in one. Amazing in low light too.

name: Allen
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2021
review_body: I love that the lens does not extend externally when zooming. This is absolutely perfect for using with a gimbal.

Which was great but i needed alot of space to film which I don’t have so i have to do the filming in a friends house.  This lens got delivered from korea in 2 friggn days!! review_body: only reason i give it 4 stars is because my sony a6000 with an adapter over shoots the focus a lot and i have to sit and wait for it to adjust multiple times. other than that. one of the best lenses i’ll own. sigma is one of the best retailers for glass. image quality is sharp and crisp per usual from Sigma’s Art series.

review_body: I'm not sure if I got a bad copy or if I'm just having trouble with my LA-EA4 and LA-EA1 adapters compatibility with this lens.

name: David Alexander
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2020
review_body: Excellent lens overall, I used it at the Grand Canyon for stunning photos.  Not great in low light situations.  Meh for portrait.  Good depth of field, nice and wide for landscapes.  I used it in 16:9 photos, and the daylight photos turned out really nicely.

name: Tony
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2018
review_body: You won’t regret buying this. Great for on the go. I like the weight of it. Feels like quality in your hand bc it is. Image quality speaks for itself. Being apsc, the long end (35) feels like 50 on FF which is perfect and the short end (18) is great for getting that wider shot of you might need in most situations. Having f1.8 all the way through is fantastic.

name: TRJ
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2019
review_body: The actual barrel that the mount base (stainless steel) mounts to is an engineering plastic. So even though it feels and looks all-metal, it's not. And an important piece is breakable plastic inside. The lens will separate from the mount if any hit is taken by the lens and that in-turn tears the flex cables, making a repair an expensive proposition. All in all though, it goes head to head with L-glass for sharpness, bokeh and light gathering. Wish it were a bit more of a range as 18-35 is pretty damn limiting at times.

review_body: I mainly bought this lens for video for my 80D, works perfectly, it is HEAVY know that, is not a "walk around take pictures with" lens.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2017
review_body: This was one of the first lenses I purchased and it has served me very well. It is extremely well built and has a very solid feel. It is a tad heavy but that is a sacrifice I'm willing to make for build quality. One thing I've found I really miss from this lens is image stabilization. The auto focus is also rather poor for video, though I mostly use manual for video anyways. You can hear the clicking in your recording and it spends much time searching. Image stabilization and video auto focus aside though, excellent lens.

review_body: I didn't realize that DC for Sigma means the lens is only compatible on a crop sensor camera. :( ai was really excited to find a sigma art lens at these focal lengths, but alas, I guess I will have to wait for one that works good on a full frame.

review_body: I do not know the answer to that.  This lens was selected for its DXO Mark ratings and specs for the intended application.  Again quality is there completely.  This is my 2nd lens along with the 50 - 150 f 2.8 to run on the DX7100 so I am spoiled with top choice things at this point.  As a nonprofessional I expect to learn and do a lot with this package this summer.  I have read the good write ups and great owner comments before selecting and I think those reports are spot on no issues.  5-14-14 after doing Mother's day at Cleveland Botanical Gardens and all the flowers and staging, got great results with the lens.  Was quick to focus as I was handheld walk about, many people so it was a quick shoot thing and got the shots.

review_body: I bought this lens for my Blackmagic and it's simply a great lens to get. The autofocus is very good and the image stabilization is incredible as well. The quality of the stills I take is amazing so that's why I had to give 5 star for portrait photography. A must buy item for any videographer!

name: Y. Lee
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2015
review_body: The one I own is for Sony A-mount cameras. Early this year, I sold my Sony A57 and got the A5100--a E-mount camera. So I now use this lens with an adapter and need to shoot everything manually but still, it works great. I get great image quality consistently.

name: hector caroro
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2015
review_body: Very sharp lens. Other photographers may have issue with the auto focus. It's true! At first it miss 70% of my shot. Please adjust the Lens Micro Adjustment on the body. Be mindful that this lens don't have vibration control so keep the shutter speed @1/200 or above on hand held or as steady as you can. I'm using a 70D body and most of the shot was on point after the lens micro adjustment on the body. I had no auto focus problem after the adjustment. Work like a charm! Yes the lens is very heavy but most lens at this level are. Just like the weight of canon L series. For the quality build and image sharpness, this lens makes up for it. Having 18-35mm wide is very useful. Specially shooting a big group of people.

name: Seren
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2016
review_body: Man, I cannot praise this lense enough. It is just such a great zoom range for most things, and especially for video production. This thing is amazing on a steadicam/glidecam. The balance barely gets thrown off when zooming and is easy to correct. The ability to open to 1.8 is such an amazing help. While filming a wedding I was so glad to have this fast of a lens and for such a great price.

name: PhotoBubba
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2017
review_body: I love this lens. I purchased it to use on my Sigma SD Quattro H camera, and it has wonderful image quality, which is important since the the SD H had 50 MP effective resolution. It also covers the H sensor without trouble, even though it is DC lens. Have not noticed any vignetting at any aperture. This is a heavy lens, so realize that making a zoom that has a 1.8 constant aperture is no "small" feat. I worried about whether it would be worth the cost, but it is worth every penny I paid. Excellent build quality, feel absolutely solid, and operate very smoothly. Yo won't be disappointed.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
review_body: Pretty heavy. Takes great pics.  Works best at at a smaller fstop like 2.2 or “higher”. Does a great job at lifestyle photography as well as portrait.  I don’t seem to get too much distortion up close.  My number one lens at the moment.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2015
review_body: Great lens, will not repeat everything that's been written about it.  Much less focusing issues with this lens with my Cannon 70D than my Cannon lens, especially the 50mm.  Really surprising and odd. Did have condensation develop INSIDE lens itself when exposed to humid air from cool building.  Condensation is a given in this situation but never had it form inside the lens, after 15-20 minutes was still inside lens. After 1/2 hr indoors it cleared.  Concerned that moisture could get trapped inside and need servicing.  Will make sure to warm this lens in similar conditions.

Remember as with any new lens you get, there's a learning curve, so don't rush it in, this one has so many possibilities, and did I mention that it is fast? Having been handling lenses of all sorts for the past 3+ decades, I can assure that this one brings a lot excitement, and incredible pictures! Highly recommend for APS-C sensor formats.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
review_body: It is amazing!!!! I’m no professional and I just use it for personal use, but it works soooo easily! I use both the manual and auto focus and I just love it! Focus is better on manual focus but still, so great!

name: Lyndsey K. Hinsley
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
review_body: This lens was released in 2013 and it wasn't until 2016 that I finally purchased it. It's 2019 and this lens still holds in own as the fastest and sharpest zoom lens ever made. The focus and zoom rings are smooth as butter with a comforting resistance for video/cinema applications. Wide open, at f/1.8, there is almost no chromatic abberation or vignetting. It's simply my favorite lens of all time.

name: BTweeze
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2018
review_body: I've been wanting this lens for a long time and was not disappointed when received. I can't believe how sharp the pictures are and the nice bokah it provides. Do note that you want to do a focusing test and adjustment because I heard that these lens may need them, so if you get it and it is front/rear focusing do the adjustments or send it in with your camera body to get adjusted. Once it is adjusted for your camera you will be amazed how the pictures look.

name: William Elliott
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2018
review_body: I own two of these actually.  One Nikon mount (review here) and another Canon mount (bought elsewhere).  I attach these to my Lumix GH4 and GH5 cameras using Metabones Speed Boosters for video capture.  They are nothing less than spectacular.  I shoot in a lot of small doctors offices and cramped areas.  I also use these for shooting interviews and find they have little to no distortion.  They are a little on the big and heavy side, but the quality that they produce is stunning.

name: Michael Mello
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_body: Omg best lens i've used to date! Only negative is the weight but the auto-focus is great for video, the low F-stop creates beautiful bocca and has improved my low-light photography tremendously! Another key highlight is the fact that zoom happens within the lens so there's no external size changes when zooming in on a subject.

name: Ryan D
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
review_body: I don't know that there is a better bang for your buck as far as taking portraits using a crop sensor camera. The sharpness and the photos is unreal and the lens feels well-made. Keep in mind if you put this on a full-frame body you're going to get a black ring around the whole photo it's really only going to work on a crop sensor camera.

name: Amazon Customer

I've had this lens for a week now and I absolutely love it!!!the focus is super sharp is manual mode.the lens feels rock solid little on the heavy side but that's OK with me.the auto focus is quiet and smooth which I'm very impressed with. country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2018
review_body: I Purchased this lense a while back and was very pleased to see that it had arrive looking pristine,basically new although it was listed as used. after testing it on my canon 70d i noticed right away that it wasn't as sharp as all the reviews touted it to be, maybe a bit above kit lense quality  , but im not one to complain or rock the boat so i decided to try and make it work, (ever the optimist) over the months there was noticeable degradation to the picture quality , bearing in mind that i didn't start out at the best quality to begin with, i still didn't complain or even thought about coming on here to right a bad review. but now at present this lense (sigma 18-35mm) has stopped all together. it wont focus not even on Manual focus so im basically holding a paper weight now. Im VERY disappointed right now if i had dropped or bumped this lense in any way i would have just own up and called it a lost but after shelling out $650 on a lense naturally im gonna baby it and that i did and still im left holding the short end of the stick.

name: David F.
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2016
review_body: There are a boatload of reviews about this lens on youTube so, if you want something detailed, go there. This lens is AWESOME! It takes zero effort to shoot good photos with this thing, even on a D3200!!!!! I can't wait until the 50mm-100mm is released so I can buy that and complete my lens collection!

name: Barbara D.
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2016
review_body: Love this lens.  Just love it.  The extra opening (f 1.8) for low light work are just enough so I can now capture a concert, or people at a dance, without needing a flash or having blur.  Clear lens too, and nice bokeh (background blur) when shooting something like a flower.  Only drawback is it sometimes takes too long to "hunt" on autofocus -- not always -- otherwise, it's wonderful, and it's a gift to have a lens that stops down to 1.8 that's a zoom, even though it only goes to 35mm.  With my APS-C crop-factor the 35 is the equivalent of about 52 mm.  I'm so pleased.

name: sasha
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
review_body: the lens itself is outstanding. however, i give it four stars because it has some focusing issues with the cannon 70D. it took a lot of tweaking and it still doesn't quite get it right unless i'm shooting in live mode, in which case it works amazing, but slower. if you're not trying to shoot in high speed situations it does great. i love the shots i can get in low light but most often shoot in manual focus to make sure i get it right.

review_body: I own a 70D and purchased this to essentially replace the 18-35mm IS II. Sigma's lens of course murders the kit lens. It does indeed feel like a handful of wide primes, in optical quality and over all weight. As others have commented, it's a heavy bastard, a drastic departure from the kit lens. But I have grown accustomed to the heft. Even on hikes and lugging it through the streets I am not beat by it's weight, it's certainly noticeable though.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_body: Every time I put this on my camera I get amazing pictures. Super sharp lens at all focal lengths and apertures. I am very impressed. Superb low light capabilities, an excellent lens for shooting sunrise/sunset/night sky. Sigma has a real winner here.

name: D. Liu
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2016
review_body: I love this lens. I use it for all my vacation travels and don't even use my walk around lens anymore. It's super clear and the contrast is good. It's so fast that it's great for low light.

The lens should be dead-nuts accurate/sharp out of the box.  I simply don't have the luxury of spending that kind of time calibrating something that should have been done by the manufacturer. Maybe I'll return the lens for another...I'll update my review if I get another.

At 35mm it has very serious vignetting, and as you zoom it increases exponentially.  It is simply not useable.  Period.  Save yourself the hassle.  Going back. name: Kara Heinrich
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2018
review_body: I was so excited when I saw they added Sony to the compatibility lineup for this lens. Did 3-4 days of research on this lens before biting the bullet and purchasing it. I did not find a clear answer as to whether or not it was for e-mount or a-mount, but after reading multiple articles and watching reviews on YouTubers being excited for the e-mount launch I decided to purchase. When I received the lens it was heavy and beautiful, I immediately went to try on the lens only to discover that it was too big for for the emount. I called sigma and they let me know that anything that just says Sony is an a-mount lens. I did not want to purchase an a-mount converter on top of the lens, so I ended up returning. Disappointed because I was so excited to try out this lens.

name: Alex Addonizio
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
review_body: A fantastic lens for getting that creamy bokeh when shooting at F1.8. This lens will make any crop sensor camera look like a professional camera. Definitely worth the buy.

name: Andrew
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
review_body: Great lens. Only issue I have is the focus on it. Usually when I'm zoomed alllll the way out it may not focus the best. This can be a big deal if you're getting paid for your photography or videography.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2017
review_body: I purchased this lens used from 6ave for $629 shipped. It was said to be in "like new" condition, and it was. I was very pleased with the condition it came in. Additionally this lens is great for almost anything else, unless you need to shoot a far distance shot (which I never do). I'll include some of my most recent shots with this lens. Finally I would definitely recommend this to all my friends.

name: Mr.Four
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2014
review_body: This lens is incredible. How many good things can I say about it? The close focus (especially zoomed to 35mm), the unique look of 18mm at f/1.8, the wonderfully solid build and well dampened zoom and focus rings, incredible sharpness, beautiful out of focus areas (bokeh)... I can keep going!

name: Jaime E. Ortiz

review_body: Initially, I tested this lens with my Canon EOS SL2 and worked great! I still need testing it with other cameras, like the Canon M50 and the Sony A7III with Sigma MC-11 adapter, so I will update, but I love it! Very nice pictures out of it!

name: Dominick
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_body: This lens is the ultimate for low light shooting and bokeh. I use it with my Nikon D5600 and while it’s a great lens, it does struggle a bit with auto focus.

name: Duy Tran
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
review_body: Purchased this to fit on my Canon EOS m50 with a Canon EF - EF-M lens adapter. But other than that, perfect portrait lens.

name: wile-e-coyote
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2016
review_body: Buying used is a great way to save some money and in this case I didn't sacrifice a shred of quality. This is the lens that is on my camera the most. It's super sharp and I love the fact that I get a very shallow depth of field (f1.8) in a zoom.  This is much better than the nifty 50 for apsc cameras. The only downside,  if you consider it one is the lens has some heft to it, but it's also a mark of the quality that went into it.

name: Steve B
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2014
review_body: I cannot say enough good about this lens. Check out the glowing online reviews and you'll get an idea of how well Sigma hit the mark with this lens. The focus is fast and accurate. It does not come with vibration reduction but a lens this wide doesn't need it.

name: JRESH
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2014
review_body: Sharper than any Nikon lens I've used.

name: Nina shrewsbury
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
review_body: This lens is incredibly sharp! I’m absolutely in love! I haven’t had a chance to take it out much with being stuck inside but I’m definitely excited to.

name: A. Woodard
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2013
review_body: I was lucky enough to purchase this lens during the first batch of shipments. I immediately put it to use for both still and video use with Canon EOS cameras. I honestly could not be more impressed with a lens. It does everything well, including fast accurate focusing, smooth manual focus and zoom.  The build quality is outstanding. Even higher than most L series that I own, and very close to the Zeiss ZE line. It has a pleasing bokeh, and minimal vignetting at all focal lengths. During my last four wedding shoots, it is the only lens I have used during the entire reception.  Please Note: this lens is designed for APS-C, or cropped sensor camera bodies.

review_body: I did not received my 3 year warranty 😒 as written that will be included  but other than that everything is great

review_body: this lens is big and heavy, but even on the edges of the frame I can clearly see drops of water from my friends running on the breach. This is by far my favorite lens for my 5600.

name: A. Tolman
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_body: This is a large, serious piece of glass.  It takes sharp, colorful pictures and, in all the venues I've used it, focuses briskly and reliably.  There are times when I wish for a bit more zoom range, but the speed of the lens and the quality of the pictures means that they're croppable without loss of quality.  Works very well on my D7100.

name: Cordele Rocks
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_body: Just got my lands today and I must say this feels incredible, The pictures I’ve taken, and the videos I’ve recorded have been incredible thus far

name: John Lehmann
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2019
review_body: I was looking at buying several prime lenses and started reviewing this as an option. I am super happy I did. The lens is super fast, has better color capture and a great improvement over the kit lens. The only thing is that it is heavy. But that being said you can definitely tell it is well made.

name: Edgar Campos
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2019
review_body: Not the best for portrait photography, but it's solid for cameras that arent full frame! The autofocus is great! Video wise this is the lens to go. Photos, it could be better.

name: Elemino
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2016
review_body: The YouTube lens, or so it's called. This was exactly the reason I bought it, and it does a great job fulfilling my many needs. For filming and studio work it's an amazing lens. It's also great for photography, but for my needs it's on the heavy side and I always think twice before deciding to tote it somewhere. Still for it's intended purpose, I'd rather have the weight and build quality than the alternative. This is more or less a prime lens with some zoom, and the results are generally amazing.

name: nathan
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2019
review_body: This is already my second purchase of this lens my first one fell off the roof of a building while at a photoshoot, this lens for the money feels like a canon L series lens with how sharp it is and that great fixed aperture of f/1.8 really shines at night. Very good lens for video as well

name: Dr. DieuDonné
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
review_body: For the price is unreal! That’s all I have to say! Oh! And FRO KNOWS PHOTO was right! Best lens for Vloging!

name: Danny Le
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021
review_body: Great

name: Raymond Young
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2013
review_body: Sigma built this lens like a tank. I was happy how smooth the zoom was. I have other Sigma/Tamron/Tokina lenses where  the zoom sounds so mechanical. Every one of course would have wanted this at 18 to 55, but that's what you get for being the first zoom 1.8 out there. The pictures come out brighter in the dark, compared to the actual scene. But I noticed 1/40 1.8 was a minimum shutter speed I needed for my Canon t4i to focus correctly, otherwise at a slower shutter speed it would not focus right in low light at ISO 1600. Shooting at 1/3 stop over, my girlfriend's pictures turned out bright and complementary, smoothing out her complexion.

name: Luis Medina
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
review_body: Package Came Early And Product Is Flawless

name: Kal
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2016
review_body: Amazing lens. Haven't taken it off since I bought it! I do a lot of portrait work, and I find that this lens doesn't have that much distortion compared to the kit lens that came iwth my camera. I bought it so I can photograph events more easily, and the constant 1.8 aperture is perfect for that. (YES! It is a constant aperture. It can shoot at 18 f1.8 and 35 f1.8)

name: tman5890
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2014
review_body: This is the best built, best performing, and best looking lens I've ever owned. I saved up months to purchase this item and I'm so glad that I did. The pictures are amazing and the aperture is fantastic for bokeh. The only downsides are the zoom, if it had a larger zoom I'd say this would be the only lens I needed. I have tried it in low lighting, but have not tried it out for stargazing shots. I plan on taking more pictures with this lens soon and I will update my review with what I find. So far I would say this lens is a must buy!

name: christina schran
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
review_body: This is an awesome lens

name: bb58
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2015
review_body: Pros: Excellent bokeh, very fast auto focus though I use the manual focus most of the time. f/1.8 picks up great light at night and is very crisp when stepped down to 2.8 and on. Metal body makes it very solid construction.

name: Eric
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2015
review_body: Using this lens for indoor, street, night portrait and day portrait photography is fantastic. You can get a pretty wide panorama at 28mm equiv. if you need it, and 50mm equiv. with incredible brightness and bokeh for portraits. The AF is lightning fast in all but the darkest scenarios and it's nearly silent. The lens is a bit heavy but clearly well built and easy to use, with the focus rings gliding effortlessly. Have used for personal nighttime shoots and professional nighttime and indoor shoots, and the quality is incredible even paired with a simple Canon T3i.

name: J Fry
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021
review_body: Product was not as described. It was fair quality and listed as like new. Very good quick shipping tho. But not happy with fraudulent description.

review_body: Probably my most favorite lens in the bag right now,  we use it for Video and Photography and absolutely love it!!!!!

name: Amazon Customer
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2016
review_body: The constant aperture and the lens' clarity are phenomenal. The only two drawbacks are the focal length and lack of image stabilization, but the lack of these features is well worth the price point — especially if you do a lot of model or concert photography and have steady hands. At f/1.8, image stabilization isn't a problem because it brings in a lot of light; either way, find a way to keep your shutter speed above 1/200 and stability shouldn't be a problem.

name: Hemifam
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2019
review_body: This lens is absolutely amazing and guaranteed to make your photos and videos crispy. It has an extremely fast and quiet auto focus, it also fits perfectly in my camera bag. I highly recommend this lens to anyone that shoots photography or films videos for YouTube. You surely won’t regret purchasing this lens.

name: Amazon Customer
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020

name: Doscho
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2014
review_body: If you are considering this lens, stop. Buy it. It is in high demand because it is the best value glass for a crop lens in these focal lengths. I mourn every time I take this lens off to shoot wildlife with my 75-300 f4-5.6.

name: Louis
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2015
review_body: Very, very heavy. I wanted to love this lens, but I need to travel a lot and its too heavy and big! Its so well made. The number of reviews that found focusing problems with Pentax was also a key concern. Its an amazing lens if weight is not an issue. The focus issues seem to be software related so may be resolved in a future update.

name: Chris J.
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020
review_body: Updated the quality considerably for my youtube channel.  Highly highly highly recommend.

name: Bill
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2019
review_body: Very sharp across the frame even at f1.8. f4 is sharp corner to corner. Only downside is the seller I received this from sent an international version with NO WARRANTY. Be aware If you see them going for around $639 you may receive the same.

name: spl42
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2017
review_body: So far this lens has been everything I've been dreaming about for past two years. Image is Sharp, the build quality is top notch it's really solid I'd say about a pound and half of weight. Just well made, great image. I use this strictly for video. If you're looking to take your filming to next level and maybe like me you can't afford a $2,000-$3,000 camera this lens will help.

name: Joelrunner
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2016
review_body: I had a 50mm prime f1.4 lens, and a 17-55mm f2.8 lens stolen out of my car. I loved (and needed) them both, and was not looking forward to the cost of replacing them...  I was hesitant that this lens would replace them both, but I actually like it BETTER due to the flexibility it has.

name: Thomas Kovacik
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
review_body: I use this lens on my black magic pocket 6k and its INCREDIBLE. This lens is so sharp, even wide open. Best lens for your S35 cam.

name: Gyle Santillana
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2018
review_body: If you like taking pictures whether it's for professional use or as a hobby buy this lens. Yes it's heavy, yes it's a bit pricey but this is very much worth the money if you want an all in one lens. DO NOT BUY A KIT LENS, BUY THIS LENS

name: Steve B.
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2019
review_body: Using this on a Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 4K. Easily my most-used lens. No image stabilization sucks, but to be fair the BMPCC 4K should have that internally. Can't go wrong with this one.

name: Wayne B.
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2015
review_body: Nice lens, though quite heavy, but that is not surprising for a f1.8 zoom lens.  Like some others have noticed it seems to have trouble focusing accurately when not in live view i.e. problems with phase detection auto focus, but works better with contrast detection auto focus. I have been using it with a Pentax K-3ii.

name: Emmy
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019
review_body: Auto focus should be more accurate.  Takes beautiful pictures with brilliant colors and sharpness.

name: Joseph qamar
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2016
review_body: This lens is amazing. I was worried about AF issues after reading other posts on here but I did not find any AF Issues while using my Nikon D5500 . Great auto focus, great sharpness. This lens is a MUST for any DX camera. If you are considering to upgrade to an FX camera, you should try this lens and keep your DX camera instead. The low light capability and noise reduction and color dynamic is great

name: Meagan Kole
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2018
review_body: You can just feel the quality of this lens when you hold it. Before I even took any video or pictures with this lens I knew I would really like it. After messing with it some I really enjoy it, and how easy it is to get fun shots I have always wanted to get.

name: Eagle

I could cary it with me during two 4hr hiking trip without any real problem.

name: Tori L. Jackson

name: SteveAnon

I haven't tried every lens out there, but it has to be the best zoom lens for a crop sensor. For $800!!!

name: AJW.1

review_body: This lens deserves all the accolades and more... not a single complaint out of me... love this piece of glass! name: Mariko K
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2018

name: Working Man

name: Ron P

This lens been sold out for a year, and at least 2 months average wait for back orders. That shows you how great this lens is. Amen.

name: Amazon Customer
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2017

name: william avelar
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2019
review_body: Great lens overall. As expected from reading other reviews of this lens, needed some calibration with this lens( front focusing ). Once issue was fixed , lens incredibly sharp! Highly highly recommend.

name: A. Virili
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2016
review_body: Sharp, versatile, fast (lets in a lot of light at 1.8).  I use it mostly for video, but when taking photos, the autofocus is smooth and fast.  It's solid (and heavy) and I love that it's a completely sealed zoom (more difficult for dust to get into it) with a constant aperture.  I have other lenses, but 95% of the time use this one.

name: pal2tech

name: Tony M

name: Tamora
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2015

Just add good zoom lens to your arsenal and you have everything you need to take awesome photos!

name: Zakalwe

name: Denise

name: Top Notch Approved Deals

For my use, this is now my all round lens.

name: Higbe33

name: Ben Jackson
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_body: I know, why would it be for the price. But this lens gets recommended a lot for video work, and nobody seems to ever talk about this fact. I have a Blackmagic 6K and used to have a RED Epic. Did I expect it to be parfocal? I dunno, I suppose I did, as I previously had the Canon 24-105 and that was. But what's really infuriating to me is that nobody seems to mention it. If I'd just been told before I bought it (like I'm telling you) I would have really appreciated it, and known what I was getting into with this cheap (but otherwise still great) lens. Without parfocal, I'm constantly changing zoom and having to refocus every time. Not just in the middle of shots, which is basically impossible: I try to do an artistic zoom in/out for a comedy moment or something, and then it's REALLY blurry and I end up messing up the shot and have to try it like 10 times, which annoys the actors. But I'm also talking about between shots, to do a reframe to get a mid or CU etc. Especially completely open, the focus is very specific, and so when I change focal length then I have to get focus again and the actor has to be in place to check focus etc etc. It makes me look unprofessional, basically. It's just something that I feel people should know as every time I read a website recommending lenses for the BM6K nobody EVER warns that it's not parfocal, they just make out it's this super lens that has no downside. I'm considering just ditching it and adding to my Rokinon cine prime collection, with a 16mm that'll actually get me a bit wider (I already have a 35mm, 85 and 135, all of which are just not wide enough for the sensor on the blackmagic for anything but mid/CU which has lead me to stop using them at all). Yes it takes longer to switch a lens than it does to change zoom and focus even when dealing with the sigma not being non-parfocal, and I'd still have all the issues I mentioned with making actors stand in for focus because now I have a whole new lens, but for me, it's just very frustrating to think you can rely on a single lens for most shots, especially given everyone recommends it, when you really can't. Changing lenses at least is understood on set, and seems professional. It's NOT professional to not be able to rely on your gear to get the shot you need, and have to ask for another shot because you messed it up. I dunno, obviously with prime lenses I can't even do zoom in/outs during shots, so I'd be stuck anyway. But at least prime lenses will give me more flexibility and the 35 and 85mm are even faster. Of course, the other solution that's probably ideal for my situation would be the $4k version of this, the cine one that apparaently IS parfocal (i haven't confirmed this though). So that's probably what I need to get when I have the money. If you have the money, don't waste it on this - I wish I hadn't - just put it towards the more expensive Sigma cine lens with the same 18-35mm and T2 (which I think is the same as F1.8) which also have nice gears etc, or a set of cine primes if you don't need the zoom function and have time to change out lenses. Or do get this one, but knowing it's not parfocal up front, so you're not disappointed. As for photography work which this lens is more intended for, it's probably perfect and not being parfocal doesn't really matter!

Once you get the adjustments in, it is just amazing. Shooting into direct sun it doesn’t have too much chromatic abberation and only some glaring but it’s not too bad. This lens does really well in low light as well. It is definitely a more expensive lens for APS-C cameras but I say after lens adjustments it is a highly capable lens. The images just didn't pop like we expected them to.  After learning a little bit about photography (aperture priority mode is your friend!) we decided to bite the bullet and get a good lens and let me tell you the difference between this lens and the kit lens is night and day.  The colors are vivid and the images pop straight out of the camera.

name: Tyson Hunsaker
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020
review_body: Sigma Art 18-35mm is legendary for a reason. This lens is shockingly sharp and fast throughout the aperture and zoom range. It's beautifully renders the image and the craftsmanship and build quality is stellar. Sigma takes care of their art lenses and its obvious their more affordable lenses in the Art series lives up to the name of Sigma. This lens doesn't however have image stabilization so be aware of this. It's also very sharp and "clinical" as some have called it which means it doesn't have much "character" so be aware. I personally love that in a lens so it's perfect for me.

name: S. Peter Lewis
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_body: I've been a pro shooter for over 30 years and use primes almost exclusively. This lens equals or beats my primes in the same focal-length range. And with a 1.8 max aperture, it truly gives full frame bokeh on APS-C cameras. It's built like a tank, has very smooth zoom and focusing rings, and there is essentially no chromatic aberation, even wide open. Yes, the auto-focus can be spotty, but don't let that deter you: it's quite easy to fix with your camera's micro adjustments, and in live view and manual it's perfect anyway. This is just about the finest APS-C lens I have ever used. Sigma hit this one completely out of the park!

name: Chris Basden
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
review_body: I'm primarily a video shooter. The value in this lens is simply unparalleled! It's been said in every product review out there, but there's just not another option if you need a fast, wide zoom lens for crop-body cameras. I'm using with an 80D, but I'll have this lens long after that camera's dead and gone. I plan to upgrade to an EOS R (Full frame, but you can use this lens with that body in crop mode) eventually, but as "outdated" as my 80D is, I'm getting great results using this lens. This is a no-brainer buy!

name: Daryl
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_body: Pic with nikon d3400. Left was just playing with lightroom and right is straight fr the camera.

name: Kamk
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
review_body: I've only had the lens for 1 day, but I think so far the quality is wonderful. I was able to get a shot of all the food on our table from my seated position, and take some nice, crisp closer shots. I wish I could take off half a star because this lens is extremely heavy. I use this with my Sony A6400 + Sony A to E mount adapter + the lens and it weighs almost 7lbs.

name: Mp Vision
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2016
review_body: The media could not be loaded.

name: thatmanphil
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2017
review_body: The first thing you'll notice about this lens is that it's big and heavy.  People say it's like owning three fast primes in one; i say it's also like carrying three fast primes in once.  Attached to my 80d I find myself holding the kit buy the lens instead of the body. But it's well worth the fast aperture and image quality.  Even shot wide open at f1.8 pictures are very sharp and predictable.  Don't let the limited zoom range put you off, 18-35 is extremely useful and is perfect for street photography, travel, events, and portraits. With this lens you really can  get a pro level look to your images. The full time manual focus is the icing on the cake here, and i find myself preferring to focus manually at times.

name: Brittany U
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2016
review_body: I just cannot say enough positive things about this lens. This was probably the most expensive lens I've ever bought, I try to buy used and otherwise hunt for deals on lenses that are ~300 or less, so needless to say I was a little hesitant to drop $800, but man was it worth it. This lens performs as if it were three times the price at least. I've always been a fan of wide-angle images, and on my 35mm camera I loved the way my 28mm 2.8 created the perfect mixture of depth but gave that "context" of a wide angle, something you lose with telephoto lenses. This lens is sharp, collects amazing light, has beautiful color, has a great build quality... I can't say enough things. My favorite lens.

name: alexw
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2017
review_body: I cannot recommend this lens enough. I would probably buy it at $1000, it's that good. And the only reason for the discount over other L glass is that 18-35 is a somewhat limiting range. Everything you get within this lens' capabilities though is absolutely without compromise. Wide open at 18mm?

name: Erick Breneman
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2014
review_body: Got this from another vendor, as my wife wanted to get for Father's day and it was backordered here. Heavy, but needs to be to get that f/1.8 across the range of zoom. I love this lens. It acts like a prime lens for quality, crisp clean images. Having the ability to take a picture of an entire house from the sidewalk on the same side of a street, or an entire side of a car that is only 10 or so feet away is awesome. The little bit of zoom to 35mm (56mm equivalent on my canon t4i) is a great normal eye-width view. I've only had for a few weeks, but it rarely leaves my camera.

name: Dante
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
review_body: N/A

name: Dennis
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2017
review_body: Superb Lens! I use this with my D7200 and it's an excellent pair for taking photos of events, landscapes, etc. It's not much of a portrait lens due to it's short focal length; ie does not flatter appearances as subjects appear slightly wider than they actually are. However, for my needs, it's perfect! I bought this off Adorama and for the same price on Amazon; I received a sigma docking station for free. Fortunately for me, my lens did not need to be configured as the front and back focusing were good. The free sigma docking station is very useful however for future sigma lenses, and I do intend on purchasing more from this brand considering how well they've made the Sigma 18 35 1.8.

name: Lens Therapy
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2015
review_body: A little about me, I do photography part-time and I normally shoot on my D7100. I like to play with different brands and have used Tokina, Rokinon, and Tamron, along with my Nikon and Sigma lenses. The amazing quality of this lens has stopped me from moving up to full frame.

name: Sam Genilo
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2019
review_body: Amazing. That is all.

name: David Wang
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2014
review_body: This lens is amazing, the quality you get for your money is unbelievable. For about 900$ you get to basically cram the Canon 20mm, 24mm, 28mm, and 35mm prime lenses into one convenient body (which would all together cost about 5000$). This lens is Canon L lens level image quality, often even surpassing the Canon lenses in terms of chromatic aberration, vignetting, color and sharpness. The bokeh is creamy and beautiful, and the f/1.8 capability adds great low-light versatility. The focusing is also fast and quiet, and you can tweak it with the Sigma USB dock if you so desire. Furthermore, the build quality is amazing and you can expect it to last you for a long time. The only downside I would say is the weight, it's quite hefty but what do you expect for zoom lens with a wide aperture.

name: Amazon Customer
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2014
review_body: Used it for trip to Torres Del Payne, Chile and OMG I stuck with it with Canon 60D....fantastic lens.  Why can't Sigma make it as FF??  Please Sigma make FF version and I am willing pay more than what you were charge right now, seriously.

name: NY's
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
review_body: I have been using this lens for the last 3 weeks and so far it has exceeded my expectations. Even nikon lenses don't have the image sharpness that this provides. Performs better than my nikkor 50mm. Don't debate...buy it. It is a keeper.

name: Max
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2017
review_body: its a very good lens with fantastic IQ and sharp.,just the limited range and a little bit of sound while auto focus in video and hence have to use an external mic.,it can replace  4 primes in your bag.,28,35,50 and maybe a macro .,nothing like this out there.

name: Anri
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2017
review_body: Very nice lens, i am using Canon 70D and have no issue with autofocusing.

name: JP
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2013
review_body: I've had the Sigma 18-35mm since August of 2013. I didn't know what to expect at first, but this lens stays on my t4i more than all my other lenses (Canon 50mm 1.4 and 85mm 1.8). Ever since using it I can't help but be pleased with its performance. IT is sexy.

name: Anonymous
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2016
review_body: Bought this lens mainly for videography. Being completely new to the game, when i tried to record in broad daylight I was dissappointed because I could not record at F/1.8 without raising the shutter. However I purchased an ND filter and problem solved! Loving it so far. Also great for photography!

name: Dennis
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
review_body: Excellent image quality and construction

name: Bren
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2015
review_body: I must say this lenes is the whole package when it comes to sharpness and quality. I use it primarily for video on my 70D,  The two problems I must say is it's pretty heavy alone and don't even mention adding other equipment. The other problem I encountered is the focus jumping in and out at times for no reason, I best suggest you MF for video. For pictures it's great especially in low light and dead sharp the auto focus is fast, smooth, and quiet. Other than that I would recommend this lens 100%

name: B. W. Sharp
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2014
review_body: I have now had this lens for about 6 months and it just keeps getting used more and more.  I used it to shoot a concert last night in really poor lighting and not a single good angle.  This was the only lens for this environment, it delivered sharp pictures in very low light.  I use a 7D and the lens is not treated well by me as I walk around it still looks like the day I bought it.  This is my first Sigma lens but it won't be my last based on this model.  Only con I can think of is that it is very heavy and it does not focus lightning fast  when moving but is very quick on fixed objects.  Highly recommend to anyone shooting with a APS-C sensor.

name: Mike
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2016
review_body: One of the best investments I've made so far... aputure goes from 1.8 to 1.2 which makes it great in low light when pairing this lens with a speedbooster and GH4. This lens is also very sharp!

name: Danny
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2016
review_body: Yes, this is a big heavy lens. No, it isn't weatherproofed. No there is no OS/IS. Those things considered, this is still my favorite lens in this focal range. I use this with a Metabones XL & GH4. This lens has replaced my Canon 16-35 mk II and is tack sharp wide open. I can't recommend it enough.

name: Pete
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
review_body: As with all of Sigma's recent lenses, this one is very sharp throughout it's zoom range. Also like Sigma's recent lenses, the autofocus does hunt a little before acquiring the subject. It's not much of an issue, this is obviously not a sport lens, more of a street photography lens or wider angle portrait lens.

name: bryan
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2015
review_body: Probably the best lens I have yet to use for a crop body camera. Solid and very well constructed, impressive. The focus ring and zoom ring both rotate firm and smooth, no clunking around. Auto focus is fast and accurate, no in-camera adjustments needed.

name: Jinzei
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2016
review_body: This is an amazing lens like everyone says. Not really much to complain about optically, focuses really fast like a native lens.  I had to get mine slight calibrated, though.  My only major complaint is that it weighs like a tank.  Prepare to get some nice bicep curls.

name: Cade
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2016
review_body: I love this lens! Edges are sharp as a knife, even at the widest aperture and the it feels sturdy and excellently built.

name: Christopher R. Vickers
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2014
review_body: I was taking pics at a church during a wedding.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2018
review_body: This lens is fantastic except for one major problem: it is not calibrated correctly for Nikon bodies. This lens consistently misses focus, regardless of aperture. On manual focus, you will see how sharp it is. But on auto focus - center spot - it misses focus at least half the time.

name: Adam
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2016
review_body: This stays on my D7100 most of the time.  I use it for MMA and Boxing &  I've taken it to Iceland.  It's a beast.

name: Mark
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2014
review_body: I use this lens almost every weekend for my job, photographing everything from high intensity mud runs to relaxed tail gates. I can tell you that this lens is so sharp, that when my photos are printed on 36 in poster sheets, the sharpness even looks better than my 70-200 f/2.8 printed at 6x10. its built like a tank and I would reccomend this to anyone

name: stevenj2
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2016
review_body: Large and heavy for APSC. Build quality good. Focus is the issue. Send mine today 9-14-16 to Sigma  on Long Island with a Pentax body to calibrate.

name: Kirby
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2013
review_body: This is an amazing lens. Kind of heavy though. But if your getting the canon version it's listed at $977. It's being sold for $800 everywhere else. Buy it from B&H and save money.

name: Gunliver
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2014
review_body: If I could only have a single lens, this would be my choice.  Super versatility in wide-angle and lower light arenas.  Heavy, heavy lens, increases stability.  I also shoot the 8-16mm ultra-wide for more drama, but it does not have the light capacity this one has.

name: H. S. Chauhan
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2014
review_body: This works really well with my Nikon 5300 DSLR. Really sharp photos. The lens is a little heavy, but I do not mind it since the build quality of lens is excellent.

name: chris
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2014
review_body: Fantastic Lens.

review_body: Although this listing does not say so this lens must be the Pentax mount since it has the same model number as the B and H listing for the Pentax mount.

name: SpeedRacer
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2015
review_body: Such a sweet lense.  From the first photo this lense felt right, so far zero complaints only love.

name: Chris
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2013
review_body: Bought local since I was wary of Sigma lenses in case I had to return it.  Best lens I've ever owned, simple as that.  Incredibly sharp and fast.  The focus is smooth.  The build quality is like a tank... which is also its only downside, it's REALLY heavy.  If you're not self conscious about toting around such a large lens, it makes for a perfect indoor low-light lens.

name: Chris from Edmond, OK
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2016
review_body: Used with a Canon 7d Mark II. 4 out of 5 shots fail to focus correctly. Close enough to look sharp and fool you in the viewfinder...but disappointment is waiting for you once you view full size. All those amazing shots you thought you got were actually ruined.

name: YourTechGuide

review_body: This lens is amazingly sharp. The build quality is top notch. It does what it supposed to do, takes great picture and excellent videos. Click here for my video review:  [...]

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2016
review_body: Just got it one week ago. It is very sharp but need to be calibrated as it front focuses... So after spending 900CAD, I've got to spend close to $100 to make it accurate... this is very frustrating as I thought the usb dock was delivered with the lens

name: yahoouser
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2016
review_body: Well I bought this lens during the "hype" of "first Zoom lens with F1.8, and a few "reputable" youtube channels seem cannot say enough about the good things of this lens

name: Loreley
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2018
review_body: Let's start with the positives. This lens has amazing sharpness and its focal length and constant aperture are huge pluses for me. The build quality is excellent.

name: Mister M
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2017
review_body: I just got this combo and i did adjust the lens in-camera already. Everything was working perfectly fine and getting sharp images. Last week I shot at my kid's school play in the auditorium. The lights were turned off for the entire show and only with the spot lights toward the stage. No problem, ALL my photos came out perfectly focused and sharp.

review_body: Great lens at a great cost.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2015

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2017
review_body: Possibly the worst autofocus of all time, but images are crisp and clear. I shoot on the Canon 7D, perhaps it is my own camera with issues, but my other lenses work fine.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2016
review_body: This lens does not focus well with the new Canon 80D in live view and viewfinder. Shooting at 1.8 will make all your photos soft. The lens is sharp with manual focusing but that is a pain to do. Hope sigma fixes this problem soon.

country_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2018
review_body: I returned the product, because the auto focus is non-existent and always miss-focuses. Front AND sometimes back focuses randomly (tested it extensively with view-finder and live-view). Just look it up online and you will find other people having the same issue. I used mine with a Canon 80D. Only buy if you're using exclusively manual focus for video and/or photo.

name: Tricia
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2015

review_body: this  lens had trouble focusing if used with Phase Detection AF (Canon 70D), almost 95% of the shots are out of focus, becomes worse if you use the center focus point with wide open aperture. checking online confirmed that it is a common issue , and a firmware update did not help at all, I am returning my lens. it is a shame because purchased the lens after reading about its amazing sharpness and quality,

review_body: I love it, it works well! Exactly what I was looking for.

name: M
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_body: Found this lens at the last minute, to shoot a wedding with my old Canon 60D. It’s amazing! Hand held shots during Mass, 800 ISO at f3.2 and sharp as can be. Used the 18-35 for 95% of my event.👍

name: Project26Productions
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021
review_body: I love this lens it’s amazing . I’m not to sure what happen with the first one I received. Maybe that should be looked into the issue was the zoom ring would softly click from 18-35 mm them a little softer click going from 35-18 mm. My new one is back to being that amazing lens I know the sigma 18-35 mm art is. I would recommend this lens to anybody . Thank you guys for the new replacement will be making more purchases in the very near future.

name: Tray Sharpshire
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2021
review_body: I’ve read a lot of great reviews about this lens before I initially bought it and was able to get my hands on it. It’s a really high-end lens at a very affordable price, very sharp even when it’s wide at an wide open aperture.

name: Kallika
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2022
review_body: Unfortunately, when photographing at 18mm you do get vignette on the corners when looking through the view finder. If in live mode you can see the edges. I prefer looking though the view finder, so for me this isn’t ideal. I have a Nikon D850. I love the lens; although, it is heavy. Autofocus is super and the motor doesn’t make a noise. Image stabilization I haven’t run into problems. I’ll be using this lens to photograph people capturing bokeh.

name: UmP
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2022
review_body: Quick and easy to use. One of the must have lens for format you are trying to shot like portraits. Get the best blur effects in the background, as long as your subject has gatherer space from the background.

name: Skyelar H
country_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021
review_body: This lens is amazing! This is my first lens I’ve ever bought and I’m so glad I did! I’m the Digital Content Coordinator for my company. I professionally record and produce videos and take pictures for this company. I use the Canon 90D and this lens works so well with it. The sharpness is amazing and works great while taking videos and pictures. I did have to use the sigma dock to fine tune the auto focus. Beware the auto focus in this lens is not the best but if you are patient and use the software to fine tune it the experience will be great! Highly recommend!

name: Thomas Hansen
